business.headline: Putin says Trump's tariff stance reflects fear of India's economic riseRussian President Putin said that the tariff actions by US President Donald Trump and concerns raised by Western nations over India's Russian oil imports reflect worry about India's rising economic influence.

No need for haste: Vladimir Putin on BRICS currency, de-dollarisationVladimir Putin's comments come at a time when conversations around de-dollarisation, alternative payment networks, and local currency trade have gained momentum within the BRICS bloc, especially after Western sanctions reshaped the global financial landscape.

Our energy cooperation with India remains unaffected, says Vladimir PutinAs Western pressure intensifies on countries buying Russian crude, Vladimir Putin said that India–Russia energy ties will continue unhindered and remain anchored in long-standing commercial trust.

Move out of comfort zone: Uday Kotak warns businesses as rupee hits record lowRecent comments by Uday Kotak highlight the effects of foreign investor actions on the Indian stock market, with Indian investors responding as buyers amid international exits.
Sensex, Nifty recover to end higher as IT stocks lift marketsThe S&P BSE Sensex added 158.51 points to close at 85,265.32, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 47.75 points to end at 26,033.75.

New rent rules for 2025: Will tenants finally get a fair deal?High rental deposits often force families to block large sums of money for years. The new 2025 rules hope to fix that. An expert breaks down how these changes could reshape renting and strengthen household finances.

India's economy is booming, but why is the rupee tumbling?India's economic growth is surging, yet the rupee keeps weakening as global risks rise and dollar demand expands. Why is a growing economy unable to prevent its currency from sliding further?

IBM CEO Arvind Krishna explains why tech layoffs have increasedIBM itself announced plans this year to cut thousands of jobs as it shifts focus to areas like artificial intelligence consulting and software.

Tier-2 cities and women investors drive India's crypto boom: ReportIndia's crypto landscape is changing fast, with Tier-2 cities and women investors emerging as the strongest new drivers of growth, according to a new report.

Investing Rs 5,000 in mutual funds? Why you should not go for multiple SIPsAre you planning to start investing with a Rs 5,000 SIP and thinking multiple funds will give you better diversification? Expert says this common approach may actually weaken your long-term returns. Here's how.

Are real estate investments outpacing stocks? Study points to 15% returnsA new study suggests that Indian residential property delivered 15% returns over the past year, surpassing many equity portfolios and challenging popular narratives about real estate's investment value.

Rs 30,000 crore IPO wave is coming in December. What should investors knowDecember includes large names such as Meesho, ICICI Prudential Asset Management Company (ICICI Pru AMC), Clean Max Enviro Energy Solutions, Fractal Analytics, Juniper Green Energy, and several mid-size and SME firms.

Will gold hold above Rs 1.30 lakh? Here's what experts sayGold prices in India remained stable as traders waited for the outcome of the US Federal Reserve meeting, with attention on both international and local drivers amid market volatility.

Aequs IPO: Check latest subscription details, GMP and moreThe grey market premium for the Aequs IPO is currently around Rs 45.5. Based on this, the estimated listing price works out to approximately Rs 169.5, implying potential listing gains of about 36.69% over the upper end of the price band.

Having undisclosed foreign income? Why is CBDT urging taxpayers to review ITRsThe CBDT has launched the second NUDGE campaign, contacting taxpayers who have not disclosed foreign income or assets, and setting a deadline of December 31 for revising Income Tax Returns to avoid penalties.

Applying for Meesho IPO? Investors should be aware of these red flagsThe IPO will close on December 5 and the allotment will be finalised on December 8. Meesho is set to list on the BSE and NSE on December 10.

PwC India flags tax shortfall but says FY26 fiscal deficit still on trackWhen the government presented the FY26 Budget earlier this year, it expected gross tax revenue to touch Rs 42.7 lakh crore. PwC now believes the final number will be closer to Rs 40 lakh crore, signalling a shortfall of nearly Rs 2.7 lakh crore.

Sensex opens 100 points lower, Nifty below 26,000; HUL down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was up by 110.14 points as it recovered to 85,216.95, while the NSE Nifty 50 added 41.15 points to 26,027.15 as of 9:39 am.

Meesho vs Aequs vs Vidya Wire: Which IPO offers the best value?Meesho IPO was subscribed 2.46 times on Day 1, with retail investors bidding 4.13 times their quota. Aequs saw even stronger retail interest at 12.16 times, pushing its overall subscription to 3.56 times. Vidya Wires, a smaller issue, was subscribed 3.16 times overall.
1,232 IndiGo flight cancelled in November, aviation regulator probesThe Directorate General of Civil Aviation sought reasons from the airline over the cancellations of flight and delays in time.

entertainment.headline: Nick Jonas gives shoutout to Priyanka Chopra at Jonas Brothers' TCL ceremony Singer Nick Jonas publicly thanked Priyanka Chopra for her support at a Hollywood event honouring the Jonas Brothers, coinciding with the couple's wedding anniversary and reflecting on their journey together.

SRK, Kajol mark 30 years of DDLJ with bronze statue unveiling in London Bollywood stars Shah Rukh Khan and Kajol commemorate three decades of the iconic film Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge by unveiling a bronze statue at London's Leicester Square, marking the first time an Indian movie is honoured in this way.

Hrithik Roshan can't wait for Ikkis, says Agastya Nanda got him cheering Sriram Raghavan's film Ikkis, starring Agastya Nanda and Simar Bhatia with Dharmendra in his final on-screen role, receives praise from Hrithik Roshan. It is set for a December 25 cinema release.

KJo wins Best Host at Asian Academy Awards for Traitors. Check Season 2 details Karan Johar won best host at the Asian Academy Creative Awards for 'The Traitors' on Thursday. The reality show's second season is reportedly scheduled to stream from March 2026.

Emily in Paris Season 5 trailer: Lily Collins takes love and chaos to Rome The trailer for season 5 of Emily in Paris introduces Emily's new journey in Rome, highlighting her professional and personal struggles as she takes on a leadership role and navigates new relationships. The series will be released on December 18, with all episodes available at once.

Hello, namaste, assalamu alaikum: Aishwarya Rai greets fans at Red Sea Festival Aishwarya Rai's warm greeting -- "hello, namaste, assalamu alaikum" -- captivated fans at the Red Sea Film Festival. The actor looked graceful in her black gown as she spoke at a session.

Ajay Devgn hilariously asks Jaaved Jaaferi for dance lessons in birthday wish As actor Jaaved Jaaferi turned a year older on Thursday, his 'De De Pyaar De 2' co-star Ajay Devgn shared a quirky wish on social media. Jaaved's dancing skills were reflected in the song '3 Shaukk', in which he danced alongside his son Meezaan.

Sonam Kapoor recalls Anand Ahuja's New York proposal on 8th engagement anniversary Sonam Kapoor looked back at her 2016 New York engagement to Anand Ahuja, as the couple prepare to welcome their second child. She shared a throwback picture from eight years ago, marking the occasion.

Shehnaaz Gill says she's treated like a prop in Hindi films Shehnaaz Gill, known for her rise after Bigg Boss 13, has shared insights on her transition to film production, the challenges she faced in Bollywood, and her renewed focus on Punjabi cinema.

Dharmendra's 90th birthday tribute: Deol family likely to open farmhouse to fans Actors Sunny and Bobby Deol, joined by their families, are reportedly set to mark Dharmendra's 90th birth anniversary at his Khandala farmhouse. They are likely to open the gates to fans, allowing them to pay their respects to the late actor.

Palak Muchhal breaks silence on Palaash-Smriti Mandhana wedding being put on hold Singer Palak Muchhal opened up about the emotional challenges the families are facing after the wedding of cricketer Smriti Mandhana and her brother Palaash Muchhal was put on hold.

Madhuri Dixit breaks silence on whether her marriage with Dr Shriram Nene was arranged Madhuri Dixit has revealed about her marriage to Dr Shriram Nene, whether it was arranged or not. She emphasised that true happiness comes from personal relationships, valuing her husband and family as her greatest blessings over fame or accolades.

Diljit Dosanjh tells the story of one shot in Chamkila that broke him. Video Diljit Dosanjh discussed his experience portraying Amar Singh Chamkila in the biopic following his Emmy nomination. He shared personal insights and gratitude for the late artist.

Bhay The Gaurav Tiwari Mystery teaser: Karan Tacker, Kalki lead paranormal series The teaser for Bhay – The Gaurav Tiwari mystery was unveiled today. The series highlights the paranormal investigator's life and mysterious death.

Tu Meri Main Tera title song uses Saat Samundar beat without permission: Rajiv Rai Filmmaker Rajiv Rai has objected to the alleged use of the iconic opening beats from his 1992 film Vishwatma's Saat Samundar in the teaser for the upcoming Kartik Aaryan and Ananya Panday film 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri', set for release on December 25.

Amitabh Bachchan shares a painful experience from Khaike Paan Banaras Wala in Don Amitabh Bachchan shared the challenges he faced during the filming of the classic song 'Khaike Paan Banaras Wala' from the film Don, revealing details about repeated takes and the physical toll of chewing paan multiple times.

JioHotstar this week: The Bad Guys 2, Dies Irae and more This week, JioHotsar offer a diverse lineup featuring coming-of-age drama, horror thrillers, action-packed sequels, and family mysteries. From Griffin in Summer to Dies Irae and The Bad Guys 2, viewers can pick from feel-good stories to dark, gripping worlds.

Kriti Sanon's sister Nupur to marry Stebin Ben in January, venue not finalised Kriti Sanon's sister Nupur Sanon is reportedly set to marry singer Stebin Ben in January. While Udaipur is being considered, the family is exploring multiple venues before finalising details.

Jaya Bachchan on most disturbing phase of her life: Couldn't stop crying Jaya Bachchan opened up on one of the most difficult periods of her life at a recent session in Mumbai. The veteran actor and politician spoke about the phase when she couldn't stop crying.

general news.headline: A handshake and a hug: PM Modi rolls out red carpet for PutinRussian President Vladimir Putin is on a two-day state visit, his first since 2021, coinciding with the 25th anniversary of the India-Russia strategic partnership. Several key agreements are expected during the summit.

IndiGo cites pilot shortage for mass flight cancellations; seeks relaxationThe DGCA has ordered the airline to submit a detailed roadmap on crew recruitment, training, roster restructuring and a mitigation plan for ongoing disruptions, along with fortnightly progress reports. IndiGo has warned that cancellations will continue for the next 2–3 days and that it will scale down operations from December 8.

Putin says Trump's tariff stance reflects fear of India's economic riseRussian President Putin said that the tariff actions by US President Donald Trump and concerns raised by Western nations over India's Russian oil imports reflect worry about India's rising economic influence.

Our energy cooperation with India remains unaffected, says Vladimir PutinAs Western pressure intensifies on countries buying Russian crude, Vladimir Putin said that India–Russia energy ties will continue unhindered and remain anchored in long-standing commercial trust.

Do you have any regrets? Putin said this to India Today's Editor-in-ChiefIndia Today got a glimpse of one of the world's most scrutinised leaders when the group's Editor-in-Chief, Aroon Purie, and Vice Chairperson and Executive Editor-in-Chief, Kalli Purie, interacted with the Russian President in Moscow ahead of his India visit.

Live: PM hosts Putin for dinner at 7, Lok Kalyan MargRussian President Putin in India Live Updates: Russian President Vladimir Putin landed in Delhi for a two-day state visit to India for the 23rd India-Russia Annual Summit. He landed at Delhi's Palam airport where Prime Minister Narendra Modi received him with a hug. The two leaders then sat in the same car and left the airport. During the visit, Putin will hold talks with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, focusing primarily on trade, investment, economy and defence. President Droupadi Murmu will also receive him and host a state banquet. He is likely to be accompanied by senior officials from the Russian government as well as leading figures from the country's business community. Stay tuned with India Today for all Live Updates.

Couldn't live up to promise: IndiGo CEO apologises over chaos in letter to staffIndiGo CEO apologised after hundreds of flights were cancelled, delayed, leading to massive chaos on airports across cities over the last three days.

Establishing independent Palestine will end Gaza conflict: Putin to India TodayIn an interview with India Today, Russian President Vladimir Putin backed Palestine in the ongoing conflict against Israel. He said that the establishment of an independent Palestine will end conflict.

Raj Nidimoru's ex-wife Shhyamali says no to drama after his marriage to SamanthaShhyamali De broke her silence with a note three days after ex-husband Raj Nidimoru married Samantha at the Isha Yoga Center. She thanked well-wishers and firmly said she wasn't seeking drama or attention.

Nato is real danger, Ukraine can't join it at Russia's cost: Vladimir PutinThe Russian President argued that established principles of international security state that the safety of one nation cannot come at the cost of another.

Modi-Putin carpool diplomacy: Russian President rides with PM in FortunerThe two state heads shared a ride for the first time in a made-in-Russia Aurus sedan to the Ritz-Carlton in China's Tianjin, where they held bilateral talks on the sidelines of the 25th Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit.

Is tradition broken with no Opposition-Putin meet? A look at previous visitsAhead of Russian President Vladimir Putin's visit, Rahul Gandhi accused the Narendra Modi government of breaking an old tradition of inviting foreign dignitaries on state visits to meet Opposition leaders.

Tell my boss to not fire me: IndiGo flyer's plight mirrors thousands' todayDespite repeated pleas at help desks and boarding gates, many IndiGo passengers claimed they were left without any staff support or announcements even as flights continued to be cancelled or delayed for hours.

White Fortuner grabs focus as PM Modi welcomes Putin at Delhi airportAfter President Putin arrived in Delhi, Prime Minister Narendra Modi joined him for the drive from Palam Airport to the PM's residence in a white Fortuner.

Mother Russia not for sale: The story of the statue behind Putin in Ekaterina HallPutin in India: The statue, Russia, features prominently in India Today Group's exclusive interview with Russian President Vladimir Putin. It is a replica of the statue that the USSR, the predecessor of today's Russia, refused to sell to France even as it gave away other artefacts for 2-million rubles in 1900. This is the fascinating story of Russia, a statue that embodies Mother Russia.
I am a doctor and here's what I know how older adults can prevent fallsA geriatrician shares her experience with older patients about healthy ageing - physically, mentally, and emotionally.

India's economy is booming, but why is the rupee tumbling?India's economic growth is surging, yet the rupee keeps weakening as global risks rise and dollar demand expands. Why is a growing economy unable to prevent its currency from sliding further?

PM Modi not one to give in to pressure: Vladimir Putin to India TodayIn a major world exclusive, Russian President Vladimir Putin spoke to India Today Group's Anjana Om Kashyap and Geeta Mohan at the Kremlin ahead of his historic visit to India.

Exclusive: Just two friends in a car, says Putin on viral carpool with PM ModiIn a major world exclusive, Russian President Vladimir Putin spoke to India Today Group's Anjana Om Kashyap and Geeta Mohan at the Kremlin ahead of his historic two-day state visit to India.

Samantha's mehendi pics are a tribute to simplicity and Raj's silent love languageFresh images from Samantha Ruth Prabhu and Raj Nidimoru's wedding events in Coimbatore emerge online as friends and family share heartfelt posts.

Putin's 'Flying Kremlin' to India world's most tracked flight todayRussian President Vladimir Putin's plane was the world's most tracked flight earlier today, according to Flight Radar 24, as he arrived in New Delhi for talks with Prime Minister Narendra Modi."

Taliban erect Greater Afghanistan map with parts of Pakistan on poet's graveThe Taliban have placed a "Greater Afghanistan" map, depicting parts of Pakistan as Afghan territory, on Pashto poet Matiullah Turab's grave. This comes amid a fragile ceasefire and escalating cross-border tensions between the neighbouring countries, and could be seen by Islamabad as an act of provocation.

Retired? Pakistanis poke fun at Asim Munir as appointment suspense drags onAsim Munir: In technical terms, Pakistan is currently without a serving army chief or a Chief of Defence Forces in place. The new CDF post would have made Asim Munir the most powerful man in Pakistan. But, the Sharif government has not issued a notification yet.

Visiting dignitaries' call: Government sources on Rahul Gandhi's Putin meet chargeDismissing Rahul Gandhi's claims, government sources clarified that it is up to the visiting delegation to organise meetings with opposition leaders and that the Centre has no role in it.

SRK, Kajol mark 30 years of DDLJ with bronze statue unveiling in LondonBollywood stars Shah Rukh Khan and Kajol commemorate three decades of the iconic film Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge by unveiling a bronze statue at London's Leicester Square, marking the first time an Indian movie is honoured in this way.

Hrithik Roshan can't wait for Ikkis, says Agastya Nanda got him cheeringSriram Raghavan's film Ikkis, starring Agastya Nanda and Simar Bhatia with Dharmendra in his final on-screen role, receives praise from Hrithik Roshan. It is set for a December 25 cinema release.

sports.headline: Joe Root played the innings of his life in Gabba Test: Atherton hails England batter Ashes 2025: Michael Atherton hailed Joe Root's long-awaited Gabba century as the finest innings of his career. Root's composure under immense early pressure from Starc and Boland turned gave England an anchor amidst a batting collapse.

Messi shocks fans with sceptical World Cup claim: At worst, I will be watching Lionel Messi has shocked football fans by admitting he may not play at the 2026 World Cup, even as he stressed his desire to join Argentina's title defence. The world champions will travel to North America without any confirmation from their captain, whose future remains uncertain as he nears his 39th birthday.

East Bengal into AIFF Super Cup final after humbling Punjab FC 3-1 East Bengal powered into the AIFF Super Cup final with a commanding 3–1 win over Punjab FC. A blend of sharp finishing and set-piece dominance guided Oscar Bruzon's side to their second cup final of the season.

Nathan Lyon furious after Gabba Test snub, refused to sit with coach and selectors Australian spinner Nathan Lyon has voiced his disappointment after being dropped for the second Ashes test in Brisbane, his first home omission since 2012. Despite his strong record, selectors opted for an all-pace attack, with Michael Neser included in the squad.

Lando Norris not asking McLaren for favours as F1 title fight goes down to Abu Dhabi Norris refuses to ask teammate Oscar Piastri for a title-deciding favour, even if it hands Max Verstappen the crown. As McLaren eyes a rare double, the Brit insists the championship should be earned on track — not gifted through team orders.

Wasim Akram still the GOAT: Mitchell Starc reacts after breaking all-time record Mitchell Starc rewrote history at the Gabba by becoming the most successful left-arm fast bowler in Test cricket. Yet even after breaking Wasim Akram's record, he insisted the Pakistani legend remains the true pinnacle of left-arm pace.

Zak Crawley praises humble Joe Root after much-awaited Australia hundred Ashes: Zak Crawley praised a "flawless" Joe Root after the 34-year-old finally ended his long wait for an Ashes century in Australia on the opening day of the pink-ball Test in Brisbane on Thursday.

Vikramaditya Chaufla beats Russian veteran on way to Indian Racketlon Open title Racketlon is a fast growing sport where the competitors are required to play four racket sports: table tennis, badminton, tennis and squash.

Snubbed for SA T20Is, Mohammed Shami shines in SMAT to knock on selection doors Mohammed Shami, left out of India's T20I squad for the South Africa tour, knocked on the selection doors once again with the match-winning bowling performance in SMAT.

Root not just an average Joe: Conquering the final frontier leaves Aussies red-faced Ashes 2025-26, 2nd Test: Joe Root answered years of Australian criticism with his first Ashes century Down Under, turning the "average Joe" jibe on its head and giving England a powerful foothold in the day-night Test after posting more than 300 in the first innings.

Go ball, yes Joe: Ben Stokes full of emotions as Root snaps century-curse at Gabba Ashes 2025: Joe Root's long-awaited maiden century in Australia lit up an otherwise tense opening day at the Gabba. Ben Stokes' emotional celebration captured the magnitude of the moment as England battled to stay afloat in the Ashes opener.

Dewald Brevis's Raipur special amazes Pretoria Capitals coach Sourav GangulyFormer India captain Sourav Ganguly said Pretoria Capitals are particularly excited about securing Dewald Brevis's services for the long term. Ganguly praised the young South African after he lit up Raipur with a blistering knock that played a key role in one of the most remarkable run chases ever seen on Indian soil.

Root vs Starc's magical tussle sets tone for gripping Pink Ball Test in GabbaAshes: A gripping battle between Joe Root and Mitchell Starc set the tone for what could turn out to be a defining Test match at the Gabba. The duo headlined Day 1 of the 2nd Test where the teams traded blows in a see-sawing game.

Mark Wood casts doubt over return in Adelaide Test after painkilling injectionsMark Wood has cast doubt on his availability for the third Ashes Test in Adelaide, citing ongoing knee trouble. The England fast bowler, who only recently returned from surgery, said he is more likely to be fit for the Melbourne or Sydney Tests after undergoing painkilling injections and spending time in a knee brace.

Matthew Hayden doesn't have to run nude, thanks to Joe Root's maiden ton Down UnderAshes 2025-26, 2nd Test: Matthew Hayden's bold take finally came to fruition as Joe Root went on to score his maiden Ashes hundred in Australian soil, leaving the legendary Australian batter relieved that he did not have to run buck naked.

Meet Sarwagya Singh Kushwaha: A 3-year-old chess prodigy with a FIDE rankingThree-year-old Sarwagya Singh Kushwaha has become the youngest player ever to earn an official FIDE rating, rewriting chess history with his extraordinary achievement. His rapid rise and victories over international opponents have stunned the chess community.

Ashes: Joe Root breaks curse, hits maiden Test hundred in AustraliaAshes 2025: Joe Root finally broke his century drought in Australia with a superb maiden hundred at the Gabba, rescuing England from an early collapse. His innings delivered the stability and intent England needed amidst a batting collapse.

Hardik Pandya fan craze triggers SMAT venue change as crowds overwhelm organisersHardik Pandya's return to domestic cricket sparked unprecedented fan chaos in Hyderabad, forcing officials to shift Baroda's SMAT match to a larger venue. His comeback has reignited excitement and raised expectations ahead of India's T20 assignments.

How does the World Cup 2026 draw work? A look at how 48 teams will be groupedThe FIFA World Cup 2026 draw is all set to take place at the Kennedy Center in Washington, D.C, on Friday, December 5. Here's a look at how the draw will take place and how the teams will be grouped.

RoKo's future being decided by people who have not achieved much: Harbhajan SinghIND vs SA: Harbhajan Singh's pointed remarks questioning those deciding Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's futures have reignited debate within Indian cricket. His comments land amid rising rumours of tension involving head coach Gautam Gambhir and the senior duo.

Starc breaks Wasim Akram's record, becomes left-arm pacer with most Test wicketsMitchell Starc went past Wasim Akram to become the left-arm pacer with the most number of wickets in Test cricket history.

DSP Richa Ghosh begins duty as ACP Siliguri after World Cup successAfter playing a key role in India's World Cup triumph, Richa Ghosh starts her new journey in uniform as ACP Siliguri, taking up duties soon after receiving her DSP appointment.

Ruturaj Gaikwad for 2027 ODI World Cup? R Ashwin urges long run for CSK captainIND vs SA: Ruturaj Gaikwad's first ODI hundred has sparked fresh debate about India's batting order, with Ashwin saying the team must find space for him even when Shreyas Iyer and Shubman Gill return.

Irfan Pathan blames Ravindra Jadeja disappointing knock for Raipur lossIND vs SA: South Africa beat India on Wednesday, in the 2nd ODI of the series. Irfan Pathan blamed India's death overs batting for the loss despite the hosts hitting a total of 358 runs.

Why Cameron Green's IPL 2026 bidding war can't cross Rs. 18 Crore markCameron Green is expected to live the millionaire dream during the IPL 2026 auction, with many teams interested in him. However, the all-rounder cannot be sold for more than Rs. 18 Crores.

Age does not matter till Rohit, Kohli continue performing with bat: Tim SoutheeIND vs SA: Tim Southee feels that age does not matter for Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma till they keep contributing runs in ODI cricket. Southee believes that India should carry the greatest ODI player of all time to the ODI World Cup 2027.

Mumbai Indians acquire Oval Invincibles in the Hundred, new name revealedReliance Industries, owners of the Mumbai Indians, and Surrey County Cricket Club have entered a partnership, officially announcing the renaming of the Oval Invincibles franchise to MI London in The Hundred.

Rohit Sharma's eyelash falls, Pant's has the most millennial reaction everIND vs SA: Wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant and opener Rohit Sharma shared a hilarious moment in India and South Africa's 2nd ODI match in Raipur. The incident sparked massive nostalgia amongst the millennials.

Premier League: Arsenal grind out Brentford win, Chelsea suffer shock lossArsenal reinforced their position at the top of the Premier League with a disciplined win against Brentford, extending their unbeaten run. Chelsea, meanwhile, suffered a home defeat to Leeds United, slipping further behind in the title race.

A Virat Kohli ton finally isn't enough: India's 7-year unbeaten ODI streak endsVirat Kohli's superb 102 in Raipur could not save India, who suffered their first ODI defeat with a Kohli century in nearly seven years. His stand with Ruturaj Gaikwad set up 358, but South Africa chased it down to level the series.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
